body.p: IFRS 16 requires an intermediate lessor to classify a sublease as either an operating lease or a finance lease by reference to the right-of-use asset arising from the head lease and not by reference to the underlying asset. The IASB’s reasons are explained in paragraphs BC233–BC234. The FASB decided to require an intermediate lessor to determine the classification of the sublease by reference to the underlying asset.
